Reviews.Title: “Very bad Internet access, dishonest management, and limited value”
Reviews.Author: tomasoro
Reviews.Content: Internet connection was impossibly slow (0.14 mbps) for most of my 16-hr stay. After technical support acknowledged the slow service, I took up the issue with management and the front desk, which dishonestly pretended that this was their standard for their offering of "free high-speed Internet access" and that there was nothing wrong with the service. All rooms are noisy (although worse if you face the freeway), so if you wanted to "save" time staying at this location, be sure you will not sleep comfortably. You are much better off having a good night sleep in any downtown hotel that adds only 10 mins of extra cab time to the airport (you will drive in the opposite direction of morning traffic!!), or at pricier Camino Real or NH right at the airport. The free shuttle adds only marginal value: it leaves ONLY once every hour and they INSIST you check in with their service 10 mins beforehand, leaving the hotel invariably 5 mins late for a 10 min ride, so it is not really time-saving (if you are downtown, an early-morning taxi ride will not take more than 15-20 mins vs the 25 min free ride of holiday inn).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel close to airport”
Reviews.Author: txtootsie
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, new and clean. The room was beautiful and had one of the largest, nicest bathrooms I have seen in Mexico. The bed was comfortable with fluffy pillows and nice comforter. The staff was very helpful. I ate dinner in the restaurant and although the menu was limited, the food was great! Best of all, they have a free shuttle that runs hourly between the hotel and the airport 20 minutes away. I would highly recommend this hotel because it is also reasonably priced (half of what the hotels at the airport cost).

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for overnight layovers”
Reviews.Author: NCtravelz
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel because I had an overnight in Mexico City. The hotel is very close to the airport and has a free shuttle and free wireless. Once I cleared customs, I found the hotel office in the airport right across the hall from the exit. The office is just a small counter with coffee and couches but it was nice to sit and wait for the driver. The hotel employee quickly found my reservation and the hotel driver arrived right away. The hotel is clean and the rooms are very comfortable. I appreciated having a restaurant in the hotel. My "european sandwich" wasn't very good but the buffet looked nice. The return shuttle to the airport was very convenient and easy. I would stay here again just for the airport shuttle. Catching a cab from the DF airport can involve huge lines depending on when you fly in. I never left the hotel except to go back to the airport but if I was staying as a tourist I would stay on the zocalo instead. It didn't look like there was much in the neighborhood around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect overnight airport stop”
Reviews.Author: Princessa77
Reviews.Content: We needed to have a hotel close to the airport because of an early flight the next day. Relying heavily on the TripAdvisor reviews we decided to go with this hotel. I think it was a great choice at a reasonable price. We had no reservation but were able to get a room. It was spotless inside and had a great bathroom with more than enough towels. We went to the restaurant and found that the food was good and the prices were resonable for Mexico City. The bed was really comfortable and it was quiet enough for us to get a good nights sleep. The shuttle runs every hour on the hour to the airport. It was reliable. We had no trouble catching our flight. It took about 10 minutes to get to the terminal. Due to the location it's not great for tourism, but it is perfect for staying somewhere to catch an early flight.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected positive experience”
Reviews.Author: finewine57
Reviews.Content: I mainly travel in the USA, but have made several trips to Mexico in the last 2 years. I have stayed at several hotels in Mexico. They have always been clean (I rely heavily on Tripadvisor ratings to ensure I am staying at a decent place)...but they are not typically anything to write home about. My flight into MEX was delayed, and thus I missed my connecting flight to Veracruz. It was late, I didn't have an internet connection, and I was at the mercy of the hotels that have small storefronts in Terminal 2 of the airport. It was so late that only two hotel desks were open. I picked the Holiday Inn and I ended up being very happy with the entire experience. Upon agreeing that I'd stay with them, a gentleman carried my bags out to the hotel shuttle. I was whisked to the hotel location, checked in quickly (friendly English speaking staff), and taken to my room. The hotel was beautiful (built on an Embassy Suite concept of an open atrium area that all rooms open to). My room was very modern, fresh smelling, and clean. The bed was comfortable, bottled water was supplied (at no additional cost, unlike USA hotels), the shower was powerful and hot, and the air conditioner kept the room very comfortable. Because I was simply grabbing a place to stay and my next flight was early the next morning, I didn't get to experience any other aspects of the hotel. Based on that, I can highly recommend a quick night's stay.

Reviews.Title: “A lot of pizazz, but little substance...”
Reviews.Author: HerreroViejo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Dali on our return to MÃ©xico after a trip to the States. Ordinarily, we stay at the Hotel Riazor - close to the airport, free shuttle, great restaurant, great rooms - but I decided to try something different this time. But what a disappointment! The hotel feels very cold, to begin with. And the rooms are below what we have here in Oaxaca - which is a wonderful Holdiay Inn Express, and highly recommended! But the HI Plaza Dali is a big, cold, not-well-appointed hotel. Definitely three-star. The Camino Real is better, especially for the convenience, and the Riazor is the best deal by far, if you're looking for something close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Needs help with housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: bajapi
Reviews.Content: When I left for my days business I returned to find my bed made but no towels replaced. The trash was not removed as well. The wireless internet had a lot of problems and when it worked it was very slow.

Reviews.Title: “Very Close to Airport”
Reviews.Author: trip12345
Reviews.Content: Stayed here before an early flight out. Good shuttle service to and from airport. Friendly staff and clean rooms. It is not the newest but it has a nice atrium design and is well kept. They gave us free drinks because of priority club membership as well as continental breakfast which we missed due to an early flight. It also had a nice business center and restaurant with nice staff. Would stay here again due to location and price. (100USD incl. taxes)

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: bajapi
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed this Holiday inn a lot. Great restaurant and the food was excellent. Will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good if you need to catch a flight in the morning”
Reviews.Author: esox_ch
Reviews.Content: I spent one night at this hotel because I had to catch a flight early the next morning. The hotel is very clean and offers free airport shuttle and Internet. It is a little expensive considering it's in Mexico but still affordable. It's VERY near the Dali airport so you'll hear the planes landing and taking off quite a lot. Overall, I would recommend it to ppl in a similar situation but not for a 1-week honeymoon in Mexico City

Reviews.Title: “Not convenient location, poor menu selections”
Reviews.Author: shigeru629
Reviews.Content: There is no store or restaurant within walking distance. You need a car or get taxi for shopping, So I had no choice having dinner except this hotel restrant. I ordered pasta which was extremely salty. I mean the chef must be dropped spoonful of salt on it. Next morning I had breakfast, I had to ask for butter for bread, ketchup for fried eggs. American breakfast comes with some Mexican black paste which taste not very good. Threr was no bath tub, only shower. $100 a night is way too high for this hotel This hotel is located in industrial area, This hotel is very inconvenient and I never stay this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for safety and proximity to airport”
Reviews.Author: travelwithyourmeans
Reviews.Content: Room was excellent, large, huge shower, amenities etc. Airport pick up, make sure take the phone number so you can call from the airport. Shuttle to the airport leaves every hour on the hour. Only downside, on a very heavily trafficked road, load, and heavy curtains don't close all of the way, not great for light sleepers.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: fairytail4
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, a little further from the airport than I thought, but the free shuttle was great. Also the Breakfast buffett didnt start until 7 and we had to leave before it opened.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, modern, comfortable and excellent breakfast buffet”
Reviews.Author: emx88
Reviews.Content: This hotel was near the airport, provided a free shuttle and was within walking distance of a subway station, which we took to the magnificent Anthropological Museum. The wait for the shuttle was long and the directions on the location at the airport were poor. The room was clean and comfortable, it was freezing cold and the controls were inscrutable. The running water in the hotel was safe to drink. We greatly enjoyed the breakfast buffet (not included), with a great variety of tasty hot and cold dishes including typical Mexican food.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Business Hotel for the Solo Traveler”
Reviews.Author: TechnicalTraveler_9
Reviews.Content: I have been to this hotel seven times and it has not varied in its aproach to excellent service toward the solo traveler. The Security is excellent, the Front Desk is excellent, the Breakfast buffet is quite good, and room service is excellent. The only down side is location - but you can't do much with that.

Reviews.Title: “good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: kosala
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice-in May and June. The room was quite spacious, clean and overall, pretty good. The only problem was the air conditioner which was quite noisy. The breakfast buffet was excellent, although a little pricey. Although the hotel is close to the airport, the downside is that it is pretty well isolated from everything else. Thus, if all you want is an overnight stay, this is very good. But if you also want to go sightseeing, this is not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Near the airport”
Reviews.Author: tecouag
Reviews.Content: The only appealing of this hotel is that is located 5 minutes ride from Mexico City Airport. They send a van to pick you to the airport and they get you back when you need it. But's it's in the middle of nothing, so this is hotel is only a good option if you want to sleep close to the airport and want to avoid a very high nightly rate

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with everything”
Reviews.Author: 060111k
Reviews.Content: I chose this Hotel mainly because it's close to the airport and has a free shuttle, and was a good price. I booked on the Intercontinental Hotel web site and paid $93.60 US. The shuttle took about 5 minutes and the drivers were friendly and helpful. I arrived late in the evening and left mid morning so it was purely for a bed for the night. I was very pleased when I entered the lobby, it's impressive. My room had 2 Queen size beds, was beautiful and quiet. The breakfast was first class, with a selection of delicious pastries, and the service second to none. I think it was $10. I would recommend this Hotel for an overnight as I had.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon RODENTS!”
Reviews.Author: Boojies
Reviews.Content: All we wanted was a one-night stay near the airport, in order to catch an early morning flight. Well, there was to be NO sleep and NO rest to be found. The hotel had RATS! After trying more than one room, only to find MORE RATS, and with the manager not being available at that time , we felt we had to get out of there,and attempt to get some sleep at the airport: SIX HOURS early! We had stayed at all kinds of hotels in Mexico: from cheap to expensive, but we had NEVER experienced this before. The hotel had surely had complaints before, and nature says that if there is ONE rodent then there are MORE to be found. So why had nothing been done?? What an awful ending to our honeymoon trip. This hotel should be closed until it gets Health Inspectors' approval. Shame on Holiday Inn!

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: alonsoflor
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel with good and proffesional front desk staff. I loved to have those extra bottles of water. We ask for room service one night and was excellent. My wife and kids went next morning for the breakfast buffet and they said it was delicous. My turn to eat was more like around 2:00 pm and the food I ordered (Mexican food) was just super along wit a few cold beers :) Another thing we liked is the close location to the airport, and the complementry shutle. The surronding areas looked safe but nothing very pretty.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rriveong
Reviews.Content: My family and I had to spend a night in Mexico City en-route to SF from Mazatlan this past weekend and we were very much suprised by the accomodation at this hotel. It is a very modern and beautiful building. They have a shuttle at Gate 4 or 6 in Terminal A off the airport which runs 24 hours a day every hour on the hour. We checked in around 8:00PM and had dinner at the buffet in the restaurant on-site and it was very delicious. The room is spacious and comes with all of the modern amenities including free Internet Access. The bed is little stiff for my taste but other than that it was a very pleasant stay. We may spend a few days in Mexico City for sightseiing the next time we come to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful surprise”
Reviews.Author: hashilla
Reviews.Content: By chance, we had a last minute delay to Ixtapa from LA and had to stay overnight in Mexico City. I called Holiday Inn randomly from the airport in LA to find a room. The operator suggested Plaza Dali. As it was so last minute and our first time in M.C., we were apprehensive about where to stay. I don't know about the other hotels, but our experience at the Dali was great. Wewere very surprised to be picked up via shuttle at the airport (quick 15 minute ride to the hotel) and the staff was so friendly. The gave us great suggestions as to where to go for dinner and nightlife. They had a private drive on standby who drove us to the La Condesa area for our evening out and picked us up when we were ready to come back. The rooms were simple but comfortable and they had an acceptable gym on our floor. Breakfast in the morning was nice, the juice was fresh and the service was extraordinary. Overall, we had a nice stay and I would recommend it to any traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: parsley4733
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at this Hotel after arriving late one night in Dec 2003. This hotel is a 70's style hotel but absoulutely a must see and a walk thru all open levels can be breathtaking. Lots of Dali artwork thruout and open views to outside. Rooms are large and clean. There is a restaraunt in the hotel. Food is good and service was good. Not many accesible restaraunts close by. There is an airport shuttle which we found in the National part of the airport. Look for a person holding sign with name of hotel. You can discuss price and fix price with person there before you go to hotel.

HotelInfo.Address: Viaducto Rio de La Piedad No. 260 | Col Magdalena Mixiuhca, Mexico City 15860, Mexico
